intro: Gutierrezia longifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf galleta, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as grasslands and shrublands, and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are narrow and gray-green, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Gutierrezia longifolia plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife in its native habitat.
